info.game_comments: J! round & first 11 clues of DJ! round only.

(1, 1).clue: It's always been Pennsylvania's most populous city

(3, 1).clue: This Marx brother played Jayne Mansfield's true love in "Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?"

(5, 1).clue: Only continent to which zebras are native

(6, 1).clue: An old prospector in Alaska or what he made his bread from

(1, 2).clue: Of California's Salton Sea, Ariz.'s Salt River & Utah's Great Salt Lake, the 1 that doesn't have salt water

(2, 2).clue: 2nd son of George V, he was the current queen's father

(3, 2).clue: When Johnny Carson turned down the lead in "The Thomas Crown Affair", this star got the role

(5, 2).clue: TV sitcom on which the main character called his racially mixed daughter-in-law a zebra

(6, 2).clue: Concluding he couldn't get them, Aesop's fox disparaged what he originally wanted, calling them this

(1, 3).clue: This 7th-largest city in the U.S. is the 2nd-largest in California

(2, 3).clue: Henry IV was the last 14th c. king of England; this man was 1st to become king in the 15th c.

(3, 3).clue: Film in which Roy Scheider several times uttered the line "I think we need a bigger boat"

(5, 3).clue: In England, a deer crossing is for deer, but a zebra crossing is for these

(6, 3).clue: A morose man or a fermented feline

(1, 4).clue: The 2 points farthest apart in the 50 states are in Florida & this state

(3, 4).clue: Picasso's estate & Cary Grant lent paintings seen in this 1986 Robert Redford film

(6, 4).clue: Grain beaten to a pulp to make bourbon scalded with fresh hot "slop" left over from previous distillation

(1, 5).clue: This state name is Indian word meaning "great western river", by which they probably meant the Columbia

(2, 5).clue: In Scotland, he was King James VI, in England this 1st Stuart on the throne was called this

(3, 5).clue: Dentist role filled by Walter Huston in "The Outlaw" & Kirk Douglas in "Gunfight at the O.K. Corral"

(5, 5).clue: In Simon & Garfunkel's 1967 song, "At the Zoo", zebras are said to have these political views

(6, 5).clue: Candy the British sometimes call acid drops

(2, 1).clue: More common name for the asymmetric bars

(4, 1).clue: Though he was more flint than calcium, "Star Trek"s Dr. McCoy had this nickname

(5, 1).clue: Only sovereign state in which Latin is an official language

(6, 1).clue: In tennis, it's the part of a racket's strings that provides top power & sensitivity

(5, 2).clue: Corsicans speak their own language related to Italian as well as this, the official one

(6, 2).clue: George Washington Carver developed 118 products from them

(5, 3).clue: (AUDIO DAILY DOUBLE) Foreign language in which part of this No. 1 Hit for Joe Dowell is sung:  "Can't you see I love you / Please don't break my heart in two / That's not hard to do"

(6, 3).clue: Ed Begley won an Oscar playing Boss Finley in screen version of this Tennessee Williams play

(5, 4).clue: While Yiddish is derived mainly from German, Ladino is a Jewish language based on this one

(6, 4).clue: In the famous hymn, it precedes "that saved a wretch like me!"
(6, 4).correct response: Amazing grace! how sweet the sound

(6, 5).clue: Called "one of the mushiest songs in history", in it Ben Bolt is asked, "Oh, don't you remember" her
